result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessie L Merrill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA and Drug Abuse surcharges.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 13CF381.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
  Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
 Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.

Pay fines, costs of any remaining balances.   If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
11:05 a.m. Defendant Jessie L Merrill in court with attorney Christopher G. Klingman. Defendant Jessie L Merrill in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have recieved and revewed the revocation packet. State is recommending prison at 2 yr In & 2 yr ES. Atty Klingman request 1 yr In & 1 yr Es. Defendant makes statement.
BTC: ***SAR Prison****
18 months Incarceration and 2 years Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to any other sentence (and 13CF381, if imposed jail served)
credit 328 days less any credit received from any other case
Not eligible for the challenge program
Eligible for the substance abuse program.
Conditions:
  Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
  Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
 Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
Pay fines, costs of any remaining balances.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jessie L Merrill in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 13CF-381 and 14CF-364.

9:59 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

State moves to dismiss and read in Count 2 in 14CF-364.
Defendant will plead to Count 1 in 14CF-364.

Defendant needs to be sentenced in 13CF-381.

Atty Constable states the plea agreement.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Atty Drengler concurs.
Defendant concurs.

BY THE COURT:
For 13CF-381, Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF-364 Count 1: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-364: Count 1: Possession of narcotic drugs, specifically heroine
14CF-364: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
13CF-381:
90 Day Jail Sentence, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 1 Year
Conditions:
Pay costs
Perform 100 hours of community service
Maintain absolute sobriety with regard to alcohol and drugs and controlled substances
Obtain all prescriptions from the same pharmacy
Provide releases of information to agent to monitor
Not to possess or consume controlled substances without a prescription and take only as prescribed
Participate in any other assessment or counseling as recommended by the agent

14CF-364:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 3 Years, concurrent to 13CF-381
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 13CF-381
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
